blocks.pretty:
thm caucvgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ dom(~~>r))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ⊆ ℝ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c1 → ℂ))
  ⊣ (w0 → sup(c1, ℝ*, <)= +∞)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s0 ∈ ℝ+, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(s2 ∈ c1,(s1[≤]s2 →(abs `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1)))[<]s0)))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  syl(w0, c0 ∈ dom(~~>r), c0[~~>r]((~~>r `(Re ∘ c0))[+](i[×](~~>r `(Im ∘ c0)))))
  eqbrtrd(c0, crli, ((~~>r `(Re ∘ c0))[+](i[×](~~>r `(Im ∘ c0)))), (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦((Re `(c0 ` hs0))[+](i[×](Im `(c0 ` hs0))))), w0)
  eqtrd(c0, (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦((Re `(c0 ` hs0))[+](i[×](Im `(c0 ` hs0))))), (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0)), w0)
  feqmptd(hs0, c0, c1, cc, w0)
  mpteq2dva(hs0, c1, (c0 ` hs0), ((Re `(c0 ` hs0))[+](i[×](Im `(c0 ` hs0)))), w0)
  replimd((c0 ` hs0), (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1))
  ffvelrnda(hs0, c1, c0, cc, w0)
  rlimadd(hs0, c1, (Re `(c0 ` hs0)), (i[×](Im `(c0 ` hs0))), (~~>r `(Re ∘ c0)), (i[×](~~>r `(Im ∘ c0))), universe, w0)
  fvexd(cre, (c0 ` hs0), (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1))
  ovexd(ci, cmul, (Im `(c0 ` hs0)), (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1))
  caucvgrlem2(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, cre, c0, w0)
  ref()
  eqbrtrrd((abs `((Re `(c0 ` s2))[-](Re `(c0 ` s1)))), cle, (abs `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), (abs `(Re `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1)))), ((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ))
  fveq2d(cabs, (Re `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), ((Re `(c0 ` s2))[-](Re `(c0 ` s1))), ((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ))
  resub((c0 ` s2), (c0 ` s1))
  syl(((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ), (abs `(Re `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))))[≤](abs `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), ((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))∈ ℂ)
  absrele(((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1)))
  rlimmul(hs0, c1, ci, (Im `(c0 ` hs0)), ci, (~~>r `(Im ∘ c0)), universe, w0)
  a1i((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1), i ∈ 𝕌)
  elexi(ci, cc)
  fvexd(cim, (c0 ` hs0), (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c1))
  sylancl(w0, (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦ i)[~~>r]i, c1 ⊆ ℝ, i ∈ ℂ)
  ax-icn()
  rlimconst(hs0, c1, ci)
  caucvgrlem2(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, cim, c0, w0)
  imf()
  eqbrtrrd((abs `((Im `(c0 ` s2))[-](Im `(c0 ` s1)))), cle, (abs `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), (abs `(Im `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1)))), ((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ))
  fveq2d(cabs, (Im `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), ((Im `(c0 ` s2))[-](Im `(c0 ` s1))), ((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ))
  imsub((c0 ` s2), (c0 ` s1))
  syl(((c0 ` s2)∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ` s1)∈ ℂ), (abs `(Im `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))))[≤](abs `((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))), ((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1))∈ ℂ)
  subcl((c0 ` s2), (c0 ` s1))
  absimle(((c0 ` s2)[-](c0 ` s1)))
  releldmi(c0, crli, ((~~>r `(Re ∘ c0))[+](i[×](~~>r `(Im ∘ c0)))))
  rlimrel()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c((~~>r `(Re ∘ c0)))
  diff.hs0.c((i[×](~~>r `(Im ∘ c0))))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(cre)
  diff.cre.s(s0)
  diff.cre.s(s1)
  diff.cre.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(ci)
  diff.hs0.c((~~>r `(Im ∘ c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(cim)
  diff.cim.s(s0)
  diff.cim.s(s1)
  diff.cim.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: caurcvg
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of real numbers converges to its limit supremum. The fourth hypothesis specifies that ` F ` is a Cauchy sequence. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2005.) (Revised by AV, 12-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm caurcvg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, cfv(clsp, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  mpbid(w0, wbr(c0, cli, cfv(clsp, c0)), wbr(c0, crli, cfv(clsp, c0)))
  caurcvgr(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, w0)
  a1i(w0, wss(c1, cr))
  sstri(c1, cr, cz)
  zssre()
  syl(w0, wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf), wrex(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  rexlimivw(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))), wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf))
  rexlimiv(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf))
  a1d(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf))
  syl(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wceq(csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf), wcel(c2, cz))
  uzsup(c2, c1)
  syl(w0, wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  ralimi(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))), wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  reximia(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))
  ralimdv2(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), c1, wcel(cv(s1), c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)), wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))
  exp4a(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wi(wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s2), c1), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))
  imim1d(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s2), c1), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2))))
  expimpd(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), c1), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))))
  biimprd(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), c1)), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))))
  syl2an(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), c1), wb(wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s1), cz), wcel(cv(s2), cz))
  sseli(cv(s1), c1, cz)
  sseli(cv(s2), c1, cz)
  eqsstri(c1, cz, cfv(cuz, c2))
  uzssz(c2)
  eluz(cv(s1), cv(s2))
  rlimclim(c0, cfv(clsp, c0), c1, c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c2, cz), wrex(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  sylancr(w0, wrex(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))), wne(crp, emptycls), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))))))
  ne0ii(crp, nat1)
  1rp()
  r19.2z(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))))
  rexlimivw(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0)))), wcel(c2, cz))
  rexlimiv(s1, c1, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wcel(c2, cz))
  a1d(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s0))), wcel(c2, cz))
  eleq2s(cv(s1), c1, cfv(cuz, c2), wcel(c2, cz))
  eluzel2(cv(s1), c2)
  sylancl(w0, wf(c0, c1, cc), wf(c0, c1, cr), wss(cr, cc))
  ax-resscn()
  fss(c0, c1, cr, cc)
  diff.crp.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, csup(c1, cxr, clt), cpnf)

  diff.clt.s(s1)

blocks.name: caurcvg2
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of real numbers converges, existence version. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: caucvg
blocks.content: A Cauchy sequence of complex numbers converges to a complex number. Theorem 12-5.3 of [Gleason] p. 180 (sufficiency part). (Contributed by NM, 20-Dec-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-May-2016.)

blocks.name: serf0
blocks.content: If an infinite series converges, its underlying sequence converges to zero. (Contributed by NM, 2-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: iseraltlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . A decreasing sequence with limit zero consists of positive terms. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm iseraltlem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c2, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c1, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wbr(cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), cle, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c2, cli, nat0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

thm iseraltlem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)→ 0[≤](c2 ` c0))
  ⊣ c1 =(ℤ≥ ` c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c2 : c1 → ℝ))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)→(c2 `(s0[+]1))[≤](c2 ` s0))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2[~~>]0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)→ 0[≤](c2 ` c0)), (w0 → c3 ∈ ℤ))

  recnd((c2 ` c0), (w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1))
  1z()
  climconst2((c2 ` c0), nat1, cz)

  eqeltrd(((ℤ × {(c2 ` c0)})` hs0), cr, (c2 ` c0), ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)))
  adantr((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), (c2 ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  ffvelrnda(c0, c1, c2, cr, w0)
  breqtrrd((c2 ` hs0), cle, ((ℤ × {(c2 ` c0)})` hs0), (c2 ` c0), ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)))
  monoord2(s0, c2, hs0, c0, ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)))
  simpr((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
  ffvelrnd(c2, s0, cr, c1, (((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))∧ s0 ∈(c0[...]hs0)))
  adantr(((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)), s0 ∈(c0[...]hs0), (c2 : c1 → ℝ))
  ad2antrr(w0, c0 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), (c2 : c1 → ℝ))
  syl2an(((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)), s0 ∈(c0[...]hs0), s0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ c1, s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
  simplr(w0, c0 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
  elfzuz(s0, c0, hs0)
  syl2an(((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)∧ hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)), s0 ∈(c0[...](hs0[-]1)), (c2 `(s0[+]1))[≤](c2 ` s0), (w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1), s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))
  simpl((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0))

blocks.name: iseraltlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . The terms of an alternating series form a chain of inequalities in alternate terms, so that for example ` S ( 1 ) <_ S ( 3 ) <_ S ( 5 ) <_ ... ` and ` ... <_ S ( 4 ) <_ S ( 2 ) <_ S ( 0 ) ` (assuming ` M = 0 ` so that these terms are defined). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: iseraltlem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ iseralt . From ~ iseraltlem2 , we have ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) ` and ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) ` , and we also have ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) - G ( n + 1 ) ` for each ` n ` by the definition of the partial sum ` S ` , so combining the inequalities we get ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) - G ( n + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 1 ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) = ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) - G ( n + 2 k + 1 ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) <_ ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) <_ ` ` ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) + G ( n + 1 ) ` , so ` | ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) - ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) | = ` ` | S ( n + 2 k + 1 ) - S ( n ) | <_ G ( n + 1 ) ` and ` | ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n + 2 k ) - ( -u 1 ^ n ) x. S ( n ) | = ` ` | S ( n + 2 k ) - S ( n ) | <_ G ( n + 1 ) ` . Thus, both even and odd partial sums are Cauchy if ` G ` converges to ` 0 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: iseralt
blocks.content: The alternating series test. If ` G ( k ) ` is a decreasing sequence that converges to ` 0 ` , then ` sum_ k e. Z ( -u 1 ^ k ) x. G ( k ) ` is a convergent series. (Note that the first term is positive if ` M ` is even, and negative if ` M ` is odd. If the parity of your series does not match up with this, you will need to post-compose the series with multiplication by ` -u 1 ` using ~ isermulc2 .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 9-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:
